required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Liposomal Bupivacaine Versus Standard Bupivacaine Plus Dexamethasone in Quadriceps Sparing Femoral Nerve Block and Wound Infiltration for Total Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Randomized, Double-Blinded, Allocation Concealed Study Comparing the Efficacy of Liposomal Bupivacaine Over Standard Bupivacaine Plus Dexamethasone in Quadriceps Sparing Femoral Nerve Block and Wound Infiltration for Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy and duration of pain relief after total knee arthroplasty provided by a single injection of liposomal bupivacaine (EXPAREL®) versus standard bupivacaine with an adjuvant, dexamethasone when administered as a quadriceps sparing femoral nerve block and periarticular injection. It is hypothesized that liposomal bupivacaine is superior to standard bupivacaine with dexamethasone and will decrease time to discharge readiness.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Assessment of temporal achievement of rehabilitative goals for discharge (independent ambulation to 100 feet, stair climbing, timed-up-and-go, independent toileting, ability to get dressed independently, capacity to get in and out of bed, capability to sit and rise from a chair/toilet, independence in personal care, mobilization with walker/crutches, and NRS<5 on activity).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean postoperative pain score assessment (24, 48 and 72 hours post-operatively)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of mean post-operative pain using a Numeric rating scale (NRS)- both at rest and during active knee flexion to 45 degree at 24, 48 and 72 hours post-operatively.

other_outcome.description: Assessment of cumulative pain score reflected by area under the curve (AUC) for NRS scores through 12, 24, 36, 48, 60, and 72 hrs.

other_outcome.time_frame: 24, 48, 72 hours post-operatively, and until discharge (up to 2 weeks)
other_outcome.description: Mean daily opioid consumption as morphine equivalents using the online calculator http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/mental/MME.html

other_outcome.measure: Mean length of stay in days
Time to first use of postsurgical opioid medication
Proportion of patients receiving no post-surgery rescue opioid medication
Discharge to home versus rehabilitation services among the comparison cohorts
other_outcome.time_frame: Up to hospital discharge (up to 2 weeks)

other_outcome.measure: Total cost comparisons between the two cohorts
other_outcome.time_frame: Up to hospital discharge (up to 2 weeks)
other_outcome.description: Including medications, nursing care costs, operating room costs, rehabilitation costs

other_outcome.time_frame: Postoperatively at day 0, 1, 2 and prior to discharge (up to 2 weeks)
At 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months and 1 year postoperatively
other_outcome.description: Functional outcomes following total knee arthroplasty at 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year using the Knee Society Score.

other_outcome.time_frame: At 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months and 1 year postoperatively
other_outcome.description: Functional outcomes following total knee arthroplasty at 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year using the Lower Extremity Functional Score

other_outcome.time_frame: At 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months and 1 year postoperatively
other_outcome.description: Activity levels following total knee arthroplasty at 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, and 1 year using the University of California Los Angeles scores
Objective quadriceps strength assessment using a Biodex isokinetic dynamometer at 24 hours post-operatively and at the time of discharge

other_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, and up to 1 year
other_outcome.description: Patient perceived health outcomes at 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, and up to 1 year using Short Form-36 scores

other_outcome.measure: Evaluate and observe any adverse reactions and complications
other_outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization through study completion (up to 1 year)

arm_group.description: Liposomal bupivacaine (EXPAREL®) 133 mg in 10 mL for quadriceps sparing femoral nerve block and 133 mg in 20 mL for posterior knee compartment periarticular injection.

Bupivacaine 0.5% 10 mL plus 2 mg dexamethasone for quadriceps sparing femoral nerve block and bupivacaine 0.25% 20 mL plus 2 mg of dexamethasone for posterior knee compartment periarticular injection.

intervention.description: Liposomal bupivacaine (EXPAREL®) 133 mg in 10 mL for quadriceps sparing femoral nerve block and 133 mg in 20 mL for posterior knee compartment periarticular injection.
Bupivacaine HCl 0.5% 10 mL plus dexamethasone 2 mg for quadriceps sparing femoral nerve block and bupivacaine HCl 0.25% plus dexamethasone 2 mg for posterior knee compartment periarticular injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients of American Society of Anesthesiologist (ASA) I-III physical class with a pre-operative diagnosis of primary osteoarthritis scheduled for elective primary total knee arthroplasty.
- Patients must be living independently at home prior to undergoing primary total knee arthroplasty with intention of discharge directly to home after hospitalization
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects will not be eligible for this trial if they have a history of allergy to a local anesthetic
- Known peripheral neuropathy
- Known connective tissue or immunological disorders
- Stroke or other known central nervous system disorders
- Renal dysfunction
- Hepatic dysfunction
- Cardiac dysfunction other than hypertension
- Pregnant subjects
- Immunosuppression
- Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)
- Alcohol or drug abuse
- Chronic pain or opioid dependence
- Coagulopathy or those unable to comply with study requirements.
